Articles.Content:
Disclaimer: This would have not been possible without the amazing work of Kerdinand, who designed the Horseguard, I used many of his techniques in this build, the engine, the propellor, the integrated intakes and most notably the open cockpit, which is almost a carbon copy of his, if you want to see his Horseguard, the link is Here.

Bunting Aerospace Division (BAD) presents their first aircraft...! The Bunting 101 Monoplane!

Features:

* Two seats, so you can bring your friend/kid/dog/kat/kirlfriend along for the ride!

* Fun, easy and stable flying!

* Safety parachute.

* Open cockpit, get some fresh air!

* Great aesthetics!

* Propellor, with a hidden jet engine so it looks as if it works!

This beautiful and fun aircraft is BAD's first aircraft under their new admindistration by SAP Conglomerate, BAD has been producing craft for 107 years! And on their fifth year of business they started the Bunting Annual Air show! The Bunting 101 Monoplane's reveal is part of the 102nd BAAS, and here is the story!

Javascript is disabled. View full album

The crowd was very happy and impressed with this craft, here is some quotes from the audience.

"An honest revolution, as expected by the renowned Bunting Aerospace Division." - Kraham Kerman, a man who has attended the airshow since the beginning.

"Flippin' Awesome!" Karl Kerman, a teenager obsessed with jets, he attended to view our fighters, but was blown away by the 101!

"One wishes to hear one's opinion? One is impressed, quite." Kueen Kerman, a monarch of the United Kerbin Kingdom!

"You wont some m8? I'll give it to ya, I'll give me left ball to ya' for that blimmin' plane m8." -The Kealstone Raider.

Order your's today for only your left ball! Or get it free at your local KerbalX Hangar!

Again, be sure to check out Kerdinand's craft if you like this, as you should give 90% of the credit to him.

Thanks for looking!
Nice plane! But... Why are there no rear elevators or a rudder?
Dunno, it flies great without them though, better than most of my other craft, and excuse me if I sound an idiot, but whats a rudder?
The rudder is the control surface that attaches to the trailing edge of the vertical stabilizer.
Eh, don't need it for the 101, flies perfectly without.
